riddles.question: What has keys but no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but can't go inside?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
What gets wet while drying?
What can you catch but never throw?
I'm tall when I'm young, and I'm short when I'm old. What am I?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
What has hands but cannot clap?
What has a foot but no legs?
What has a horn but doesn't beep?
I have no mouth, but I can still talk. I often repeat, but I never balk. What am I?
I'm not a teacher, but I help you write. What am I?
I'm full of words and pictures too. Open me up to learn something new. What am I?
I ring when it's time to start or end. I'm not a phone, but I'm every student's friend. What am I?
I bear the weight of knowledge on my shoulders every day. You'll find me full at dawn and lighter by the hallway. What am I?
I'm made of sand, and I might have a moat. Build me near water, but I'm not a boat. What am I?
I have a sail but no captain or crew. I fly in the sky, and kids love me too. What am I?
I'm sticky and sweet and come on a stick. But eat me too slowly, and I'll do a quick trick. What am I?
I buzz and I hum and I fly all around. In the summer, you'll hear me; my wings make the sound. What am I?
What has a heart that doesn't beat?
What has a spine but no bones?
What has cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water?
The more you take away from me, the bigger I get. What am I?
I'm full of words, but I can't speak. I'm full of knowledge, but I can't think. What am I?
I fly without wings, I have a tail but no fur. I swim without fins, and I'm known to purr. What am I?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
I'm full of holes, but I can hold water. What am I?
I'm an animal that carries my house on my back. I never run fast; I'm known to be slack. What am I?
What has teeth but can't bite?
What has a neck but no head, and wears a cap?
I'm green and jump, but I'm not a frog. I croak and sing, especially in the fog. What am I?
What has a bark but no bite?
What has wheels and flies but is not an airplane?
What has a ring but no finger?
What has ears but cannot hear?
What has legs but doesn't walk?
I'm your home and the third from the Sun. I've got water and life—aren't I the fun one? What am I?
I'm the planet with the most bling, I've got rings you can't help noticing! What am I?
I'm red all over, with dust in the air. Some people think I might have had water to share. What am I?
I'm closest to the Sun, but I don't get much attention. I'm small and speedy—just thought I'd mention! What am I?
I've got rings around me, but I'm not Saturn. I'm tilted sideways, so my days take an odd pattern. What am I?
I'm a gas giant and the biggest by far. With a Great Red Spot, I'm the king of the stars! What am I?
I'm the hottest planet, though I'm not closest to the Sun. What am I?
I have storms that rage for hundreds of years. My winds are the fastest—no competition here! What am I?
I'm not alive, but I can grow. I don't have lungs, but I need air. I'm not a plant, but I need water. What am I?
I change shape but never disappear. I can be solid, liquid, or gas, and I'm found everywhere. What am I?
I live in the sky but fall to the ground. I'm cold and white and make no sound. What am I?
I'm hot and bright, but don't touch! I shoot up from the Earth in a big rush. What am I?
I'm round, but I'm not a ball. I have layers, but I'm not a cake. I'm in space, but I'm not a star. What am I?
How many months of the year have 28 days?
riddles.answer: All of them! Every month has at least 28 days

riddles.question: What has hands and a face, but can't hold anything or smile?
It belongs to you, but your friends use it more. What is it?
Kate's mother has three children: Snap, Crackle and ___?
If you don't keep me, I'll break. What am I?
There's only one word in the dictionary that's spelled wrong. What is it?
You're running a race and at the very end, you pass the person in 2nd place. What place did you finish the race in?
What 2 things can you never eat for breakfast?
I am so simple that I can only point, yet I guide people all over the world.
What has thirteen hearts, but no other organs?
Which word becomes shorter when you add 2 letters to it?
What's the capital of France?
What has keys but can't open locks?
What comes down but never goes up?
I go up and down, but never move. What am I?
When Grant was 8, his brother was half his age. Now, Grant is 14. How old is his brother?
Two fathers and 2 sons spent the day fishing, but only caught 3 fish. This was enough for each of them to have one fish. How is this possible?
riddles.answer: There were only 3 people fishing: one father, his son, and his son's son

riddles.question: Liam was 11 the day before yesterday, and next year he'll turn 14. How is this possible?
riddles.answer: Today is January 1st, and Liam's birthday is December 31st

riddles.question: Mrs. Brown has 5 daughters. Each of these daughters has a brother. How many children does Mrs. Brown have?
It's raining at midnight, but the forecast for tomorrow and the next day is clear. Will there be sunny weather in 48 hours?
riddles.answer: No, it will be midnight again

riddles.question: There are 3 apples in the basket and you take away 2. How many apples do you have now?
What can you put between 7 and 8, to make the result greater than 7, but less than 8?
A new clothing store has a unique method of pricing items. A vest costs $20, a tie costs $15, a blouse costs $30, and underwear costs $45. How much would pants cost?
riddles.answer: $25 (The pricing method charges $5 for each letter)

riddles.question: 81 x 9 = 801. What do you need to do to make this equation true?
Double it and multiply it by 4. Then divide it by 8 and you'll have it once more. What number is it?
What 3 numbers give the same result when multiplied and added together?
Zoey has a very big family. She has 20 aunts, 20 uncles and 50 cousins. Each of her cousins has an aunt who is not Zoey's aunt. How is this possible?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What number am I?
Which is heavier: a ton of bricks or a ton of feathers?
I am a three-digit number. My tens digit is five more than my ones digit. My hundreds digit is eight less than my tens digit. What number am I?
Using only addition, how can you add eight 8's to get the number 1,000?
You'll find me in Mercury, Earth, Mars and Jupiter, but not in Venus or Neptune. What am I?
What can go up a chimney down, but can't go down a chimney up?
I make a loud sound when I'm changing. When I do change, I get bigger but weigh less. What am I?

A bus driver was heading down a busy street in the city. He went past three stop signs without stopping, went the wrong way down a one-way street, and answered a message on his phone. But the bus driver didn't break any traffic laws. How?
I can fill a room, but I take up no space. What am I?
It's the only place in the world where today comes before yesterday. Where is it?
If I have it, I don't share it. If I share it, I don't have it. What is it?
What goes away as soon as you talk about it?
A railroad crossing without any cars. Can you spell that without any R's?
What can run but cannot walk?
What has a mouth but can't speak?
What has one eye but can't see?
Everyone has me but no one can lose me. What am I?
What starts with T, ends with T, and has T inside it?

There's a one-story house. Everything in the red house is red, the walls are red, the bathroom is red, the floor is red, the kitchen is red, all of the bedrooms are red. So, what color are the stairs?
riddles.answer: There are no stairs, it's a one-story house

riddles.question: What can you hold in your left hand but not in your right hand?
What kind of coat can be put on only when wet?
If an electric train is traveling south, which way is the smoke going?
riddles.answer: There's no smoke, it's an electric train

riddles.question: What kind of room has no walls or corners?
What do the numbers 11, 69, and 88 all have in common?
riddles.answer: They all read the same way when placed upside down

riddles.question: I have no wings, but I can fly. And I have no eyes, but I can cry. What am I?
I'm light as a feather, but even the world's strongest man couldn't hold me for much longer than a minute. What am I?
What can jump higher than a building?
riddles.answer: Anything that can jump—buildings don't jump!

riddles.question: An elephant in Africa is called Lala. An elephant in Asia is called Lulu. What do you call an elephant in Antarctica?
Imagine you are in a room with no windows or doors. How will you get out?
A group of bunnies were having a birthday party. What kind of music were they listening to?
Where would you take a sick boat?
I'm orange, I wear a green hat and I sound like a parrot. What am I?
What fruit can you never cheer up?
What did the zero say to the eight?
What do you get if you cross a vampire and a snowman?
What do elves learn at school?
What does a ghost use to wash its hair?
What has a head but no brain?
Most people think of me as money. But when they find me in the water, they won't get any money out of me. What am I?
What question can you never answer yes to?
What kind of band never plays music?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
What jumps when it walks and sits when it stands?
I sleep during the day and fly at night, but I have no feathers to aid my flight. What am I?
I can honk without using a horn. What am I?
Why do cats make good warriors?
The English alphabet goes from A to Z but my name goes from Z to A. What am I?
I am the fastest animal but cannot climb the tree. What am I?
I have horns but I can't beep. I like to bleat but I'm not a sheep. What am I?
I hide my treasure in the ground, my tail is big and fluffy. If you spot me in a tree, please don't call me scruffy. What am I?
I live in a bowl. I can swim. I have a tail. I also have fins and big eyes. What am I?
I have a hole in my back and legs I lack. I live where I can't breathe and I eat without teeth. What am I?
I have a thousand needles but I do not sew. What am I?
I am the beginning of everything, the end of everywhere. I'm the beginning of eternity, the end of time and space. What am I?
What is in seasons, seconds, centuries and minutes but not in decades, years or days?
How many letters are in the alphabet?
What happens once in a minute, twice in a moment but never in one thousand years?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
What word begins and ends with an E but only has one letter?
Which letter of the alphabet has the most water?
I come in many colors, so beautiful and bright, I turn homes into a beautiful sight. What am I?
Which one of Santa's reindeer can be seen on Valentine's day?
What kind of ball doesn't bounce?
How does a snowman lose weight?
riddles.answer: He waits for the weather to get warmer

riddles.question: Why do mummies like Christmas so much?

Santa has one neighborhood left to visit on his way to the North Pole. In that neighborhood, there's a blue house made of gingerbread, a red house made of peppermint, and a white house made of vanilla. If Santa flies to the blue house first, then to the red house and then to the white house, where does he go next?
riddles.answer: He goes back to the North Pole

riddles.question: I fall but I never get hurt. What am I?
Why were the little ghosts so successful in Little League?
riddles.answer: They had plenty of team spirit

riddles.question: How do you fix a damaged jack-o-lantern?
I protect, I stand tall. My goal is to strike fear in all. What am I?
I have a body, arms, legs and a head, but have no heart nor no guts. What am I?
Often buried with fabulous wealth I'm often called wrapped up in myself. What am I?
Which word is least like the others? Third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth?
riddles.answer: Third, it is the only one not ending in 'th'

riddles.question: What is the last thing you take off before bed?
1 rabbit saw 9 elephants while going to the river. Every elephant saw 3 monkeys going toward the river. Each monkey had 1 parrot in each hand. How many animals are going towards the river?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
What is always in front of you but can't be seen?
What goes up but never comes down?
A man walks outside into the pouring rain yet not a hair on his head gets wet. How is this possible?
What can you keep after giving it to someone?
I shave every day but my beard never changes. What am I?
You see a boat full of people yet there is not a single person on board. How is this possible?
riddles.answer: All of those onboard are married

riddles.question: You walk into a dark room holding a match and find a kerosene lamp, a candle, and a fireplace. Which do you light first?
A man dies of old age on his 25th birthday. How is this possible?
riddles.answer: He was born on leap day, February 29th

riddles.question: I have branches but no fruit, trunk, or leaves. What am I?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
What is black when it's clean and white when it's dirty?
What invention allows people to look right through a wall?
What can't be put in a saucepan?
What would you find in the middle of Toronto?
Which word is always spelled incorrectly in the dictionary?

You walk into a creepy house by yourself. There is no electricity. Inside you notice 3 doors. Door 1: You'll be eaten by a hungry lion. Door 2: You'll be stabbed to death. Door 3: There is an electric chair waiting for you. Which door do you pick?
riddles.answer: Door 3, since there is no electricity to harm you

riddles.question: All 5 sisters are busy. Ann is reading a book, Rose is cooking, Katy is playing chess, and Mary is doing the laundry. What is the 5th sister doing?
Three doctors said that Robert is their brother. Robert says he has no brothers. Who's lying?
riddles.answer: No one is lying – Robert has 3 sisters who all happen to be doctors

riddles.question: A man was found murdered on Sunday morning. The wife said she was sleeping, the cook was eating breakfast, the gardener was picking vegetables, the maid was getting the mail, the butler was cleaning the closet. Who did it?
riddles.answer: The maid – there's no mail on Sundays

riddles.question: If two's a company and three's a crowd, what are four and five?
A girl goes to the store and buys one dozen eggs. As she walks home, all but three break. How many eggs are left unbroken?
If there are five apples and you take away three, how many apples do you have?
There is a word I know, six letters it contains but, remove one letter, and twelve remains. What is the word?
You see me once in June, twice in November, and not at all in May. What am I?
There is a word that could be written forward, backward, or upsidedown and can still be read left to right. What is the word?
Forward I am heavy but backward I am not. What am I?
What five-letter word has one left when two are removed?
What is at the end of everything?
What word is pronounced the same if you remove four of its five letters?
There is a house. One enters it blind and comes out seeing. What is it?
As I was going to St. Ives, I met a man with seven wives; each wife had seven sacks; each sack had seven cats; each cat had seven kits. How many were going to St. Ives?
What has many eyes but is unable to see?
What has many needles but doesn't sew?
I have one head, one foot, and four legs. What am I?
What is 3/7 chicken, 2/3 cat, and 2/4 goat?
What has many words but is never able to speak?
What runs in the backyard but never actually moves?
What building has the most stories?
What tastes better than it smells?
What has a bottom at the top?
What has four wheels and flies?
The person who makes it has no need of it; the person who buys it has no use for it. The person who uses it can neither see nor feel it. What is it?
A man is looking at a picture of a man on the wall and states: Brothers and sisters I have none, but this man's father is my father's son. Who is the man in the picture?
Four hang, four sprang, two point the way, two to ward off dogs, one dangles after, always rather dirty. What am I?

A man is found hanging dead from the ceiling of a room. The room is 15x15x15. The man is only 6ft tall and the rope was only 2ft long. There is a puddle of water under the man. How did he kill himself?
riddles.answer: The man stood on a block of ice

riddles.question: The answer I give is yes, but what I mean is no. What was the question?
What we caught, we threw away. We kept what we didn't catch. What was it that we kept?
A man calls his dog from the opposite side of a river. The dog crosses the river without a bridge or a boat and manages to not get wet. How is this possible?
Drop me and I'm sure to crack but lend me a smile and I'll certainly smile back. What am I?
People make me, save me, change me, and raise me. What am I?
What breaks but never falls and falls but never breaks?
What runs through cities and fields but never moves?
With pointed fangs, I sit and wait. With piercing force, I crunch out fate. Over bloodless victims proclaiming my might, eternally joining in a single bite. What am I?
A woman shoots her husband then holds him underwater for five minutes. Next, she hangs him. Right after, they enjoy dinner together. How is this possible?
riddles.answer: She took a picture of him and developed it in a dark room prior to dinner

riddles.question: I come from a mine but always get surrounded by wood. Everyone uses me. What am I?
A is the brother of B. B is the brother of C. C is the father of D. So, how is D related to A?
What are the next three letters in this combination: OTTFFSS?
riddles.answer: E N T (eight, nine, and ten)

riddles.question: First, think of the color of clouds. Next, think of the color of snow. Now, think of the color of a full bright moon. What do cows drink?
First you eat me, and then you get eaten. What am I?
What can you hold in your right hand but never in your left hand?
How can you physically stand behind your father if he is standing behind you?
riddles.answer: You and your father are back-to-back

riddles.question: I have a neck with no head and two arms with no hands. What am I?
If eleven plus two equals one, what does nine plus five equal?
Once you are given one, you either have two or none?
There was a man who was born before his father, killed his mother, and married his sister. There was nothing wrong with what he had done, why?
riddles.answer: His father was in front of him when he was born. His mother died while giving birth to him. He grew up to be a minister and married his sister at her ceremony

riddles.question: Which English verb becomes past tense just by rearranging the letters?
I am never scared but became petrified and can't live in a house but would die to make one. What am I?
It has five wheels though often thought of as four but you cannot use it without that one more. What is it?
Different lights make me strange by changing me into different sizes. What am I?
My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I?
How high do you have to count before you use the letter A in the English spelling of the whole number?
What animal walks on four legs in the morning, two legs during the day, and three legs in the evening?
riddles.answer: Man (in childhood on hands and knees, in manhood walks erect, and in old age with a staff)

riddles.question: This thing all things devours; birds, beasts, trees, flowers; gnaws iron, bites steel; grinds hard stones to meal; slays kings, ruins towns, and beats mountain down. What is it?

First think of the person who lives in disguise, who deals in secrets and tells naught but lies. Next, tell me what's always the last thing to mend, the middle of the middle and end of the end? And finally, give me the sound often heard during the search for a hard-to-find word. Now string them together, and answer me this, which creature would you be unwilling to kiss?
Voiceless it cries, wingless it flies, toothless bites, and mouthless mutters. What is it?

I talk, but I do not speak my mind. I hear words, but I do not listen to thoughts. When I wake, all see me. When I sleep, all hear me. Many heads are on my shoulders. Many hands are at my feet. The strongest steel cannot break my visage, but the softest whisper can destroy me. The quietest whimper can be heard.
